Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.graph.user

Interface GraphEntity<G extends GraphEntity<G>>

Type Parameters:
G - this graph entity class.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGraphEntity
public interface GraphEntity<G extends GraphEntity<G>>
Arbitrary data that can be stored in a graph.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • onInit

      void onInit(@NotNull @NotNull GraphEntityContext ctx)
      Called when the graph entity is initialized in a graph, to give this its context.
      Parameters:
      ctx - this graph entity's context.

    • getContext

      @NotNull @NotNull GraphEntityContext getContext()
      Gets the graph entity context this was created with.
      Returns:
      this graph entity's context.

    • getType

      @NotNull @NotNull GraphEntityType<?> getType()
      Gets this graph entity's type.
      Returns:
      this graph entity's type.

    • toTag

      @Nullable @Nullable net.minecraft.nbt.NbtElement toTag()
      Encodes this graph entity as an NBT tag.
      Returns:
      this graph entity as an NBT tag.

    • onDestroy

      default void onDestroy()
      Called right before this entity's associated graph is deleted.

    • onUnload

      default void onUnload()
      Called right before this entity's associated graph is unloaded.

      Note: This cannot cancel graph unloading, however, any changes made here will be saved.

    • onDiscard

      default void onDiscard()
      Called when this entity has been created, but it is discovered that another instance of this entity has already been created previously and that this instance should be discarded.

    • onNodeCreated

      default void onNodeCreated(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> node, @Nullable @Nullable NodeEntity nodeEntity)
      Called when a new node is created in this graph.

      Note: often adding a new node to this graph will first involve creating a new graph for that node and then merging that graph into this one.

      Parameters:
      node - the new node added to the graph.
      nodeEntity - the node's entity, if any.

    • onNodeDestroyed

      default void onNodeDestroyed(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> node, @Nullable @Nullable NodeEntity nodeEntity, Map<LinkPos,LinkEntity> linkEntities)
      Called when a node in this graph is destroyed.
      Parameters:
      node - the node destroyed.
      nodeEntity - the node's entity, if any.
      linkEntities - any link entities that were removed.

    • onLink

      default void onLink(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> a, @NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> b, @Nullable @Nullable LinkEntity entity)
      Called when two nodes in the graph are linked.
      Parameters:
      a - the first node in the link.
      b - the second node in the link.
      entity - the link entity that was added, if any.

    • onUnlink

      default void onUnlink(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> a, @NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> b, @Nullable @Nullable LinkEntity entity)
      Called when two nodes in the graph ar unlinked.
      Parameters:
      a - the first node in the link.
      b - the second node in the link.
      entity - the link entity that was removed, if any.

    • onUpdate

      default void onUpdate()
      Called by the default implementations of the node update methods.

    • onTick

      default void onTick()
      Called when this graph's graph world is ticked, if this graph is loaded.

    • merge

      void merge(@NotNull G other)
      Merges another graph entity into this one.
      Parameters:
      other - the graph entity to be merged into this one.
